fields.headline: What's selling in sport books
fields.bodyText: Fittingly enough, this week's best-selling sport book is also the weightiest, handily doubling up as a 1,216-page dumbbell. Of course, the real reason for the success of Mike Hammond's new European Football Yearbook - bicep-enhancing effects aside - is that it's a Football Stato's dream come true. Want to know why Athinaikos came last in the Greek league table, or what year Dutch penalty-fluffer Clarence Seedorf was born? The answers, as you'd imagine, are all here, in the 11th edition of what remains the unparalleled bible for footie fans. As if the reams of tables, match reports and player profiles weren't enough, there's also the legendary full-colour guide to every European team's kit. "We couldn't do without it," says Manchester United's Official Magazine, leaving us to suspect that United's poor form this season could be ascribed to Ferguson planning tactics on the colours of his opponents' strips. Top 10 sport books 1 The European Football Yearbook 2001/02 ed Mike Hammond (Sports Projects, £24.95) 2 Boys of '86 - The Untold Story of West Ham United's Greatest-Ever Season by Tony McDonald & Danny Francis (Mainstream, £14.99) 3 Speedway in London by Norman Jacobs (Tempus Publishing, £14.99) 4 Ashes Diary 2001 by Steve Waugh, below (HarperCollins, £16.99) 5 War, Baby - The Glamour of Violence by Kevin Mitchell (Yellow Jersey Press, £10) 6 Marching On Together - My Life at Leeds United by Eddie Gray (Hodder & Stoughton General, £16.99) 7 Venus Envy - A Sensational Season Inside the Women's Tennis Tour by Ljon Wertheim (HarperCollins, £17.99) 8 John Eales - The Biography by Peter FitzSimons (Queen Anne Press, £16.99) 9 Full Time - The Secret LIfe of Tony Cascarino by Paul Kimmage (Scribner, £6.99) 10 Seabiscuit - The Making of a Legend by Laura Hillenbrand (Fourth Estate, £16.99) · Information supplied by Sports Pages bookshop, Caxton Walk, 94-96 Charing Cross Road, London WC2 (020-7240 9604).
